documentation.text: @dev This interface defines the methods for price query
@dev This interface defines the methods for price query

devdoc.details: This interface defines the methods for price query

findPrice(address,uint256).details: Find the price at block number

returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)

params.count: The number of prices that want to return

returns._0: An array which length is num * 2, each two element expresses one price like blockNumber｜price

lastPriceListAndTriggeredPriceInfo(addre.details: Returns lastPriceList and triggered price info

params.count: The number of prices that want to return

returns.prices: An array which length is num * 2, each two element expresses one price like blockNumber｜price
returns.triggeredPriceBlockNumber: The block number of triggered price
returns.triggeredPriceValue: The token triggered price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)
returns.triggeredSigmaSQ: The square of the volatility (18 decimal places). The current implementation assumes that          the volatility cannot exceed 1. Correspondingly, when the return value is equal to 999999999999996447,         it means that the volatility has exceeded the range that can be expressed

returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)

latestPrice2(address).details: Get the latest effective price. (token and ntoken)

returns.ntokenBlockNumber: The block number of ntoken price
returns.ntokenPrice: The ntoken price. (1eth equivalent to (price) ntoken)
returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)

latestPriceAndTriggeredPriceInfo(address.details: Returns the results of latestPrice() and triggeredPriceInfo()

returns.latestPriceBlockNumber: The block number of latest price
returns.latestPriceValue: The token latest price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)
returns.triggeredPriceBlockNumber: The block number of triggered price
returns.triggeredPriceValue: The token triggered price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)
returns.triggeredSigmaSQ: The square of the volatility (18 decimal places). The current implementation assumes that          the volatility cannot exceed 1. Correspondingly, when the return value is equal to 999999999999996447,         it means that the volatility has exceeded the range that can be expressed

returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)

triggeredPrice2(address).details: Get the latest trigger price. (token and ntoken)

returns.ntokenBlockNumber: The block number of ntoken price
returns.ntokenPrice: The ntoken price. (1eth equivalent to (price) ntoken)
returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)

triggeredPriceInfo(address).details: Get the full information of latest trigger price

returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)
returns.sigmaSQ: The square of the volatility (18 decimal places). The current implementation assumes that          the volatility cannot exceed 1. Correspondingly, when the return value is equal to 999999999999996447,         it means that the volatility has exceeded the range that can be expressed

triggeredPriceInfo2(address).details: Get the full information of latest trigger price. (token and ntoken)

returns.ntokenBlockNumber: The block number of ntoken price
returns.ntokenPrice: The ntoken price. (1eth equivalent to (price) ntoken)
returns.ntokenSigmaSQ: The square of the volatility (18 decimal places). The current implementation assumes that         the volatility cannot exceed 1. Correspondingly, when the return value is equal to 999999999999996447,         it means that the volatility has exceeded the range that can be expressed
returns.price: The token price. (1eth equivalent to (price) token)
returns.sigmaSQ: The square of the volatility (18 decimal places). The current implementation assumes that          the volatility cannot exceed 1. Correspondingly, when the return value is equal to 999999999999996447,          it means that the volatility has exceeded the range that can be expressed
